subject: Physical Fitness
title: Stabilizer Muscles
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stabilizer Muscles usable.

hook.text: You can bench press 100 kg on a machine but struggle with 80 kg using a free barbell. What changed?

buildup.text: Free weights require stabilizer muscles â€” small muscles that hold joints steady during movement.

discovery.text: Machines guide the path, so stabilizers rest. Free weights demand they fire to control the weight.

twist.text: Weak stabilizers are the hidden bottleneck. Your prime movers are strong but the support crew isn't.

climax.text: Training with free weights, bands, and unstable surfaces builds stabilizers that machines neglect.

punchline.text: Big muscles move weight. Small muscles keep you from falling over.

quiz.question: Why can people typically lift more on machines than with free weights?
options: Machines remove the need for stabilizer muscles
Free weights are heavier per kilogram
